roleset.name: be subsequent, temporally or spatially
roleset.note: FOLLOW-V NOTES: Member of VNcls contiguous_location-47.8, occurrence-48.3. (from follow.01-v)

example.name: transitive
example.text: The strong growth followed year-to-year increases of 21% in August.

example.name: passivized
example.text: [California]-1 led the nation, followed *trace*-1 by Texas, Iowa, and Florida

example.name: as temporal
example.text: *trace* Following the acquisition of RP Scherer, the maker of gelcaps decided to ...

example.name: with causal agent
example.text: Mr. Simmons has followed friendly offers with a hostile tender offer.

example.name: obnoxious intervening idiom chunk
example.text: Now Republican leaders are concentrating on attaching a capital-gains amendment to some other bill, perhaps a measure raising the federal borrowing limit or a second tax bill that-1 [*T*-1] would follow on the heels of the deficit-reduction legislation.

roleset.name: adhere to, accept, understand, pursue
roleset.note: FOLLOW-V NOTES: Member of VNcls chase-51.6, comprehend-87.2-1. (from follow.02-v)
FOLLOWING-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00040. Comparison to follow.02. Vn classes chase-51.6 and comprehend-87.2-1. Framed by Katie. (from following.01-n)

example.name: another transitive
example.text: Many investors follow a strategy of buying and holding a mix of stocks.
example.arg: a strategy of buying and holding a mix of stocks

example.name: with manner
example.text: John avidly follows Major League baseball for his father, who can only receive Italian soccer on his TV.
example.arg: for his father, who can only receive Italian soccer on his TV.

example.name: arg 1 first
example.text: its loyal following among buyers of equipment

example.name: arg 0 only
example.text: Baker had a large gay following later in her career when she was an overdressed singer rather than underdressed dancer

example.name: with arg
example.text: The following individuals were fined as indicated and barred from association with NASD members, or, where noted, suspended.

example.name: ICH
example.text: The following [*ICH*-2] were neither barred nor suspended: [Stephanie Veselich Enright, Rolling Hills, Calif., fined $2,500 and ordered to disgorge $11,762; Stuart Lane Russel, Glendale, Calif., fined $2,500 and ordered to disgorge $14,821; Devon Nilson Dahl, Fountain Valley, Calif., fined $82,389]-2.

example.name: with manner
example.text: ...``Robert Bork's America'' -- the parade of imaginary horribles that-2 [*T*-2]would follow logically, he claimed, from the positions Mr. Bork had taken over the space of two decades.
example.arg: that -> the parade of imaginary horribles
from the positions Mr. Bork had taken over the space of two decades

example.name: monkey see, monkey do
example.text: Budget Rent a Car Corp., of Chicago, and National Car Rental Systems Inc., of Minneapolis, both said [0] they-1 had no plans [*]-1 to follow suit.

example.name: not like tennis
example.text: They argue that as the Kremlin follows through on announced plans to cut land forces....
example.arg: on announced plans to cut land forces

roleset.name: xray of the upper stomach involving barium
roleset.note: FOLLOW_THROUGH-N NOTES: Based on Sharp data. Comparison to xray.01. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from follow.02-n)

roleset.name: be subsequent, pursue, do follow-up
roleset.note: FOLLOW_UP-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry follow.03 and instances in CallHome. Framed by Claire. (from follow.01-n)

role.descr: thing followed up on, coming before

example.name: optional preposition
example.text: Scty of State James Baker followed up [on] a proposal made by Bob Hawke.
example.arg: on a proposal made by Bob Hawke

example.name: Within LVC
example.text: I actually did my follow - up with Doctor Stokes because...
